text: US
Where do I even start? What should I tell you?

The things I’ve seen with my own eyes, heard with my own ears,
and felt in my heart.

About the planet, about fate, about my comrades—
all of it, I’ll share with you.
The mako city, Midgar.
The Shinra Company, dominating that massive city,

kept draining the Lifestream—the planet’s very lifeblood—
and squandering it as mako energy.

The planet was screaming in agony,
but hardly anyone noticed its cries.
Yet amidst it all, some rose to fight for the planet.
The anti-Shinra group, Avalanche.

They hired a mercenary—a man named Cloud, once a Shinra SOLDIER—
and blew up Mako Reactor 1.

In Sector 8, where the reactor’s destruction wreaked havoc,
Cloud met Aerith, a flower seller.
She offered him a yellow flower.
Its meaning: ‟reunion.”
From that moment, fate began to shift in a big way.
Avalanche set their sights on blowing up Mako Reactor 5 next,
but it was all playing right into Shinra’s hands.
Shinra cunningly deceived and manipulated the people.

Avalanche ended up framed as the culprits behind
the unprecedented disaster of Sector 7’s plate collapse.

Losing precious comrades, with everyone crushed by despair,
Aerith struck a deal with Shinra and let herself be captured.

Aerith was the last surviving Cetra,
a race once called the planet’s pioneers.

Shinra sought the ‟Promised Land”
from Cetra legend,
and they needed her power to find it.

Cloud and the others stormed the Shinra Building
to rescue Aerith.

I, held as an experimental specimen,
joined them and helped free Aerith from the research lab.
But then, the mightiest SOLDIER appeared before us.
The legendary hero, Sephiroth.

Our long-dead nemesis stole Jenova’s remains—
the origin of it all—kept in a secret lab.

Escaping the Shinra Building,
Cloud and the others raced down the highway, shaking off Shinra’s forces.
That old foe showed himself again.
And then, an ear-piercing scream echoed out,

as the Whispers—guardians of fate—
engulfed Midgar.
Facing the wall of fate, Aerith spoke up.
‟This is where our paths diverge,” she said.

We learned the road we’d walked so far
had been protected by the Whispers.
And then—the moment of decision.

Beyond that wall, we clashed
with Sephiroth, who’d absorbed the guardians of fate.

Carrying our comrades’ hopes, Cloud’s strike
cut through destiny itself.

The battle over, freed from fate’s rails,
we left Midgar behind and stood in the uncharted wilds.

And from here, a new journey begins—
one no one has ever seen before—
